abstract_ssm: Judith Bregman was a professor of Physics at Polytechnic Institute of New York from 1957 until her death in 1978.  During her time at Poly, she developed an interest in the preparation of instructional films, and is perhaps most well-known for her film 'Symmetry', which was created in 1966 in cooperation with Alan Holden, Richard Davisson, and Philip Stapp.  This collection is comprised of 16 mm films Bregman helped to create and mass-produced educational films she used for classroom instruction.  Some personal information about Bregman and her work is also included in the collection.
corpname_ssm: Poly Archives at the Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, NYU Libraries
